8128F04E547541B48CA3766FA7EE49B5.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

AAA523C6E60B45738FCACB3C6BE89EB0.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

60106455841E49A18B2C034367A13BF6.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

DB02CA0D232F4A2C844B1F10524EC36B.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

BEBFCF7E02C543A1AAFAA18575FE3655.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

AED2556929CD46F49E2D69BB1DD1896A.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

96EF4ACD376D4274BBB131C4D2C086D0.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

2EF151658A89438EBE02F89DB6AEC481.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

CA14EF5B2B174C9B9E4647FFF0EA6AEA.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

DA6CA2ACF78A4B5CAD0EB3009D2503A8.description: Participate in a work placement experience

ABA18B36ACBA480B86FC1CA911C04E6C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

25DED8742C8643A7BF2BD9506FF73A91.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

A163739625A140718F6B6C8ECA9B4206.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

86E7AFB511674568AE6A00F49F1D13D9.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? • Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

B3657FFD0E864876B78E6F2FA92BCA57.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

D89E6D541AEF4AE5968409B773997C01.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

A40ECF6E08234F0CBFA97C244EE7DBF6.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

81F5D32CA654491C971377665CCF7E04.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

C500CFDD94DA4C9CB3F9608CF3C68B74.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

DC5CFB1DEFBF489885010951392A9B11.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

EDAF2820F66146FE83CA0DCD08843A92.description: Reflect on a personal experience in an area within forestry studies (e.g., treaty education, land-based education, harvesting, reforestation, climate change, sustainability).

E5B92C6334C946169BC42242CECC85FC.description: Contrast how the forestry industry was portrayed with the in-person information gathered.

20B05564C3CE406AA9F99F3D6DCA5645.description: Collect information about a topic within forestry (e.g., treaty education, reforestation, harvesting, wildlife, mapping, remote sensing, forest fires, conservation) as it applies to the location, community, company or government organization visited or studied.

1CD98F1414DB4300B30E6260E6AE5E52.description: Research the history of forests and how glaciation and climate have shaped them to what they are today.

52F38FB050F644ECB1529123569C101E.description: Explore how forests store carbon to balance greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

D12DC3527A86484888A9E18BAA14EA7B.description: Describe how mapping can support the evaluation of forest structure and age.

4E0D2E6DAE614645B9CD24E2F1D9B242.description: Explain how mapping is part of efficiently planning each process in sustainably harvesting forest products (e.g., marking, felling, delimbing, skidding, bucking, loading).

3D7A36D97C16498799E41381FBA5E13F.description: Recognize different types of common maps such as base maps, topographic or contour maps, soil type maps, geologic maps, forest stand or type maps, or road maps.

F0135B361A954AA58E86403735B6ACDC.description: Identify heavy equipment (e.g., buncher, skidder, processor, bulldozer, scraper, mill saws, rolling equipment) used in various areas of the forestry industry (e.g., harvesting, reforestation, firefighting, milling, pulping operations).

866064466CDA408F9FF66CA0C451C29E.description: Investigate the impact of ecosystem-based management on forestry.

4D87CDCDF5EA42BBAB53C24723C45F6A.description: Evaluate different forest fire management strategies and factors used to prioritize fires (e.g., location of fire, human life, communities, infrastructure, timber and industry).

83953CD8C27C496BA442EC53FB7E2C98.description: Examine general safety requirements within the forestry industry.
